alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 06 at 5:43AM MDT until April 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Critical fire weather conditions will return on today over much of western and central New Mexico where several hours of single digit relative humidity are forecast as northwest winds restrengthen. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below any snowpack from noon to 8 pm today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping to 5 to 9 percent this afternoon. Up to 7 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit humidities are forecast in the Middle Rio Grande Valley. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
